result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M Alvarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas M Alvarez in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter is dismissed and read-in.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.  **no paper copy in physical file**
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 8 only.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Issue warrant per Judge Maxwell 4/5/16

Defendant Thomas M Alvarez in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict for Kelsey Morin.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed the non-compliance letter from WCS. State is requesting cash bail be set. Defense objects. Court does not raise the bail, but does admonish the defendant, but does order him to go to WCS after court. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants. Defense counsel to file possible Motion.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Address at next hearing per Judge Maxwell 2/5/16

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas M Alvarez
Current: 2025 Kilps Dr., Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 01-28-2016)
Prior: 634 E College Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant not to discuss the case with Malik Noblin.

Defendant Thomas M Alvarez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Thomas M Alvarez not in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
